entry.title: Re: How to prepare FS for custom purchase order form in S...
entry.content:
For PO output, from the existing layout, against each value, list out the related table and field names. For example, vendor address would be fetched from LIFNR & ADRC. PO Header data like EBELN for PO number, BEDAT for PO Date, EKORG for Purchase Org, would be fetched from EKKO. For item level data like MATNR for material code, MENGE for order quantity etc., it would be from EKPO

From functional side, it is enough if you give all the above details clearly. From technical angle, your ABAP team to take care layout, design, font size etc.

entry.title: Re: How to migrate service purchase order data by migrati...
entry.content:
Hello @Lily16 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Service Order with External Service Procurement, Procurement Integration, Migration Cockpit, API for Purchase Order

To summarise, the standard Migration Cockpit templates for Purchase Orders currently do not support account assignment category ‚ÄúR‚Äù in public cloud. The reason is because, the Service Document and Service Item Number fields are not part of the delivered migration structure for the ‚ÄúMigrate Purchase Orders‚Äù object.

The SAP Clean-Core approach recommends the following options:

  • Option A is to create Purchase Order Automatically from Service Orders (recommended by SAP)
  • Option B is to manually create post-migration: this is if you really need to migrate legacy POs for reporting.
  • Option C suggest a technical migration, where you use the side-by-side API approach. This should be considered if you need to preserve bulk historical data.

Below is step-by-step guide on how to achieve the goal:

First, search ‚ÄúMigrate Your Data‚Äù App

The screenshot uses the ‚ÄúProduct Master Data‚Äù as a reference. In your case, choose the ‚ÄúPurchase Orders‚Äù

In your case locate the Purchase Orders --> Click Download Template

Open file --> scroll through to confirm that columns such as Sales Order, Sales Item, etc., exist but no ‚ÄúService Document‚Äù or ‚ÄúService Order Item‚Äù column is present.

Go to Manage Service Orders --> External Procurement Type =Yes --> Manage Purchase Orders -->AcctAssCat = R and the linked Service Order Number.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: People Intelligence for SuccessFactors ‚Äì What It Is and Why It Matters
entry.content:
For those of us who have lived through Workforce Analytics (WFA), Report Stories, SAP BW, and countless Excel dashboards, this is more than a product update. It is the start of a structural shift - away from isolated HR reporting toward an integrated, AI-driven foundation for decision making.

At Pentos, we‚Äôve been preparing for this shift since the first announcement. After a decade of helping clients around the world make sense of their HR data, we see People Intelligence not just as a new tool - but as the new operating model for people analytics.

From Workforce Analytics to Business Data Cloud

WFA has served many organizations well. It provided a structured model and a curated metric catalogue. But it lived in a different era: one where data warehouses were static, integration meant batch loads, and analytics meant explaining what happened last quarter.

People Intelligence is built on a different architecture. At its core lies SAP Business Data Cloud- a unified platform that brings together HR, Finance, Supply Chain, Spend, and external data into one governed space. Within this space, data products like Workforce Composition, Compensation, and Skills Insights are harmonized, semantically aligned, and ready for use.

The implications are profound. We‚Äôre no longer moving data into HR-only silos; HR data becomes a first-class citizen in the enterprise data landscape. Finance and HR metrics can live side by side. Attrition patterns can be analysed alongside cost or productivity trends. In other words, HR finally speaks the same analytical language as the rest of the business.

Why this matters now

For years, HR teams have struggled with three fundamental barriers: data fragmentation, manual processes, and limited ability to predict. People Intelligence addresses all three.

  1. Unified data foundation ‚Äì By harmonizing data in BDC, organizations eliminate the classic ‚Äúone truth for HR, another for Finance‚Äù issue.
  2. AI-powered insights ‚Äì Embedded Joule, SAP‚Äôs conversational copilot, enables users to explore data through natural language. It‚Äôs not just ‚Äúshow me headcount,‚Äù but ‚Äúhow did turnover in critical roles impact delivery times?‚Äù
  3. Scenario simulation ‚Äì With integrated data and modeling, leaders can test hypotheses: what if we shift hiring from one region to another? or what is the cost of a 5 % attrition increase in R&D?

These capabilities elevate HR analytics from descriptive to strategic - bridging the gap between insight and decision.

Joule and the promise of human-AI collaboration

AI has been a buzzword for years, but Joule represents a tangible step forward. Within People Intelligence, Joule serves as a co-pilot: it interprets questions in plain language, accesses governed data products, and provides contextual answers.

Think of a manager preparing a workforce plan. Instead of navigating through a maze of dashboards, they can ask Joule: ‚ÄúShow me attrition risk for engineers in Germany over the past year, and simulate the effect of a 10 % compensation increase.‚Äù The system returns not only a chart but also narrative explanations and recommended actions. This is analytics in dialogue, not static reporting.

Why SAP is making this move

SAP‚Äôs strategic direction is clear. Business Data Cloud is the backbone for all analytical applications (Lines Of Business) - Finance, Supply Chain, Customer, and of course also People. The company knows that analytics is only powerful when the underlying data foundation is consistent. This is intergral to the SAP Business Suite Strategy.

For HR specifically, this evolution also reflects market pressure. I know that many companies have turned to external tools such as Power BI, Visier, Tableau, ChruncHR, or OneModel because WFA‚Äôs closed structure limited flexibility. People Intelligence re-centers analytics inside the SAP ecosystem by offering the same openness those tools promise - without losing governance or integration depth.

The cornerstones of the solution

From SAP‚Äôs documentation and early partner experiences, three design principles define People Intelligence:

  1. Data Products over data models ‚Äì modular, standardized, and versioned for re-use.
  2. Cross-domain integration ‚Äì enabling HR to link directly with cost, revenue, and operational data.
  3. AI and simulation ‚Äì moving from reporting the past to predicting and shaping the future.

These are not incremental improvements; they redefine what an HR analytics platform can be.

Are we limited in the data sets and metrics

People Intelligence is by design linked to SAP SuccessFactors. There are metrics covering the entire hire to retire lifecycle, starting with core HR, talent acquisition and talent management. Backed by powerful analytics and tailored insights, People Intelligence offers an holistic approach, with data from all sources ‚Äì including external data ‚Äì to understanding your organization, by delivering high-quality, harmonized data, this solution enables impactful workforce planning and seamless collaboration across your business.

  • Workforce Composition Insights: Understand the composition of your workforce and assess internal mobility trends.
  • Compensation Insights: Ensure fair and competitive pay structures across your organization.
  • Skills Insights: Identify existing skill strengths to pinpoint critical gaps and suggest potential development strategies and opportunities.
  • Succession Insights: Gain insights into succession planning to drive business continuity and talent growth.
  • Career Development Planning Insights: Get insights into development goals and skills linked to building a future-ready workforce.
  • Performance Insights: Leverage performance insights to drive productivity and engagement.
  • Goals Insights: Use goals insights to align with organizational objectives.
  • Recruiting Insights: Gain recruiting insights to attract and hire top talent efficiently.
  • Learning Insights: Utilize learning insights to offer effective training and development programs.

 

All metrics are provided out of the box by SAP and can be extended with additional customer-specific metrics and data sets from other domains, such as finance, customer and logistics.

This all means you get the core metrics covered as well as optional talent modules, depending on the landscape your organization has implemented. And the best part, of for some reason you have non-SAP modules implemented, you can create metrics covering those systems and blend with the metrics you have in your People Intelligence solution.

Preparing for transition

No end-of-life for WFA has been announced yet, but the strategic direction is unmistakable. Migration won‚Äôt happen overnight. Data governance, metric mapping, and enablement will take time.

Why early movers will benefit most

Those who begin the journey now will have the advantage of aligning HR data with enterprise data governance from day one. They‚Äôll also be first to apply machine learning and AI exploration across domains.

And perhaps most importantly: People Intelligence provides a foundation for skills-based organizations. Its integration with the Talent Intelligence Hub means you can link skills, roles, and learning to business outcomes - finally quantifying the real value of talent.

Looking ahead

This article is the first in a two-part series. In Part 2 ‚Äì Implementation Considerations, I go into the ‚Äúhow‚Äù: deployment models, integration patterns, and how to turn standard metrics into competitive advantage.

What matters now is understanding the why. People Intelligence is not simply the next version of WFA; it‚Äôs the architectural shift that lets HR operate on the same analytical backbone as Finance and Operations. It represents an (overdue) unification of data, technology, and business strategy - a space where analytics is no longer an afterthought, but an enabler of decisions.

If your organization is considering how to move from WFA or how to get started with Business Data Cloud, feel free to reach out to me to  explore how to make your HR data work smarter - today and for the future.

entry.title: How to Find and Process, in SapforMe , Cases created from a ByD or C4C Version 1 tenant
entry.content:
If in C4C or ByD built in support is not accessible , it is possible to fully process a case directly from SAPfor Me.

  • Login  to the support portal https://support.sap.com/en/index.html or access SAPforMe directly  : https://me.sap.com/home
  • Ensure you are accessing the portal with a  S user that belong to the correct account which should be the account containing the C4C or ByD installation. Your user must have  Case management access, read and write.

If you are unsure which S user to use, or whether you had the necessary access rights,  please check with our Customer interraction center

Our non technical hotline can be used, 24/7 for all  case access issues, case management, escalation request, call back, S-User management, etc.  more info : https://support.sap.com/en/contact-us.html?anchorId=section_42886245

  • Once logged to SAPforMe you can check if the S users is correct. Only a S user that belongs to the same installation and account as your tenant will let you manage your cases.

 

  • Navigate to ‚Äúservice & Support‚Äù to access all opened cases

  • Open ‚Äúview‚Äù cases

If you case was opened from the legacy built in support in C4C or ByD, you will likely not be the person assigned to the case, you can easily find all tenant relevant cases  with the filter option.  The New C4C V1 Built In Support will always display the correct user.

  • If you case is still in progress, status should be anything except for ‚Äúconfirmed‚Äù, ‚Äú not sent to SAP‚Äù and ‚Äúautomatically confirmed‚Äù

You can further filter using the ‚Äúsystem‚Äù field which is your tenant ID.

  • To find your tenant ID, open your tenant, go to the Work Center ‚ÄúService Control Center‚Äù -> ‚Äúsystem‚Äù.

From this view all tenant under your account will be visible

  • Copy the tenant ID in the filter field  of SAPforMe and it will display only the cases created from these tenants.

  • You can then edit your case and resume processing. For any support regarding case management, please contact CIC.
  • If you are not the reporter of the case you can add yourself as new contact in order to receive all case related notification

If you mark  one or multiple case as favorite , they will be displayed  on your SAPforMe Home page and you will be able to access them without searching again

 

Conclusion
With SAP for Me, managing ByD and C4C cases becomes simpler and more consistent , even when built-in support isn‚Äôt accessible. By following these steps, you can easily locate, filter, and process your cases directly from SAP for Me without interruptions. This unified experience ensures you stay connected to SAP Support, benefit from real-time synchronization, and keep all your customer interactions in one place.

entry.title: Re: How to move or delete a task from a Transport Request?
entry.content:
Dear Customer, 

 

Yes, using Export Customizing Transports app it is possible to move a task to another customizing Transport Request if the task is on "Modifiable" status. In other words, if the task was not released yet. 

In this case, the task needs to be assigned to your user. If it's not assigned, you can select the task and click on "Assign to me" button.

Once it is assigned to you, the "Move" button will be available. You only need to select the task and click on "Move". A pop-up will appear for you to choose the TR that you want to send the task. You can only send the task to TRs that are assigned to you. Therefore, in the value help, only the TRs assigned to you will be visible. If you want to send the task to a specific TR that is not assigned to you, you need to assign your user to it first by selecting the TR and clicking on "Assign to me". 

The TR also needs to be of type customizing and have the status "Modifiable". 

 

You can also delete a task by assigning it to your name and clicking on "Delete" button when selecting the task. 

 

For more questions regarding Export Customizing Transports app you might want to check KBA 3547695 - Export Customizing Transports - Frequently Asked Questions - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

 

Kind regards,

SAP Support.

entry.title: Work Around for Comp Rules changing Impurities to Components
entry.content: Hi everyone, does anyone have a work around for comp rules that do not consider the pure substances' component types when drilling down the composition tree. All sub-components of a first-level component are outputted with the component type originating from the first-level component. If a component appears as a subcomponent of more than one first-level components, the component type of the first occurrence is outputted for this sub-component. For example, if I label an ingredient (L4) as an impunity within a raw material (A), the comp rule changes the ingredient to a component in the Standard Composition. How can we preserve the CompType of second-level and beyond-level components and not default to the first level component type? If the rule cannot be modified is there a work around?

entry.title: Drive more business outcomes out of your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ‚Äì A Recommendation Guide
entry.content:
After spending almost 10 years helping customers activate and operate SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, I wanted to provide a quick guide on some initiatives based on my experience that you can follow to get more business outcomes out of your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. This blog will cover some of the top recommendations but is by no means a conclusive or complete list, as there are many other topics that can be added. Now, some of these recommendations may already be included in your subscription or some might not; this will be an individual customer situation, so I encourage you to contact your SAP Customer Success Manager, SAP Account Executive, or SAP Partner to inquire about your individual situation.

First, if you are reading this blog, it is because you have probably been operating SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for some time and are looking to get more out of your subscription investment.

If you are reading this blog and you are planning to implement public cloud, I suggest you read this first.

Let me provide you with some of my highlights:

 

  • New Innovations ‚Äì Find and explore new innovations using the Release Assessment and Scope Dependency for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (SAP RASD - A valid Customer S-user ID is required for login) to analyze new innovations included in your subscription.  I have recommended this tool in previous blogs to get ready for upgrades so you can consume new innovation and maintain your system. However, in this case I want to focus on the topic of innovation only. The tool will highlight all innovations included in a release, or you can see the innovations tailored to your productive system usage. However you want to do this, I advise you to benefit from all this new innovation that was added to your system.

New Innovations - Release Assessment and Scope Dependency for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

 

  • SAP Business Artificial Intelligence ‚Äì The SAP RASD Tool can also support exploring the special use cases for SAP Business AI (SAP Joule, Agents, embedded AI). You can use the tool to showcase what has been added into the release. Similar to the above use case, the SAP RASD tool can showcase all the topics per release or tailor them to your productive usage for SAP Business AI.

SAP Business AI - Release Assessment and Scope Dependency for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Another tool that can help you visualize the overall use cases for SAP Business AI is the SAP Discovery Center (https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/index.html), which you can use to explore what is delivered as standard so you can use it to assess your business needs. The difference with the SAP RASD Tool is that SAP Discovery Center presents all available cases independent of release for all SAP product portfolios and can also be tailored by SAP product (e.g., SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP SuccessFactors, etc.), while in the case of SAP RASD, it shows the information by SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and by release (e.g., 2508).

SAP Business AI - SAP Discovery Center

I have written on the topic of foundational elements for Business AI before, so I advise you to review this blog that contains many more recommendations on this important subject: Foundational Elements for Harnessing the Power of Business AI in Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Ed.

 

  • Manage News Application ‚Äì The Manage News Fiori application in My Home for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition empowers system administrators to deliver timely, targeted updates directly to business users through a centralized news feed. By tailoring communication to organizational needs, the application enhances visibility and keeps users informed of key system and company developments‚Äîall in a single, easily accessible location.

Manage News Application

News - My Home

 

  • Keep informed of the latest regulatory changes: If you have multi-country operations and footprint, I recommend using the SAP Regulatory Change Manager to always stay up to date with changes in regulations. More information can be found here.

SAP Regulatory Change Manager

 

  • 3 System Landscape ‚Äì If you are running a two-system landscape, you might want to work with SAP so they can convert you to the latest and greatest 3 System Landscape. The 3 System Landscape comes with additional benefits that will help you drive much more business value out of your SAP investment. To learn more about this topic, I recommend this blog and video that explain the process and benefits.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - 3 System Landscape

 

  • Parallel Line: If you are on a 3-System landscape and are not using the parallel line, you are missing out. The parallel line will provide you with an additional environment you can use to run testing, training, mock-up loads, test new configuration, try the configuration localization toolkit, etc. The parallel line can be used to avoid impacts to the main line and current business operations.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Parallel Line

I have also written about this topic in detail in the past, so feel free to look at this blog with all details:  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, three-system landscape, parallel line ‚Äì High Level Introduction.

 

  • 2-Tier ERP Strategy ‚Äì Maybe you implemented SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for some subsidiaries or maybe for your corporate business; however, the goal was, we are seeing more and more SAP customers running hybrid deployments to connect their SAP systems with either corporate headquarters running in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition or looking at SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to bring new acquisitions or subsidiaries.

2-Tier ERP

The strategies are diverse and depend on your business requirements; however, SAP has many options to support you in this using our 2-tier models. I suggest you read this blog to learn more about these specific strategies: Exploring Deployment Models for Acquisitions Using SAP S/4HANA Exploring Deployment Models for Acquisitions Using SAP S/4HANA.

 

  • Extending to the new SAP Business Suite Packages - In February 2025, SAP announced the new SAP Business Suite. The Business Suite serves as a transformation engine, helping customers generate rapid cycles of innovation and continuous improvement as a service. This enables organizations to deliver greater business value and achieve improved outcomes through end-to-end processes. So with the new SAP Business Suite, you have a great opportunity to complement your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition with some of the current packages (e.g., SAP Strategic Procurement, SAP Core HR (which includes SuccessFactors for example), SAP CX, etc.), or potentially change your entire subscription to the new SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Packages to benefit from more entitlements that cover more functionality to address specific business pain points. This last point is not available yet, but is planned for 2026, so stay tuned. But a new installation and subscription can start with new SAP Business Suite Packages right away.

SAP Business Suite

This strategy could prepare you for future consumption models where you have much more capabilities at your disposal. I invite you to learn more about this topic here: Unpacking the new SAP Business Suite.

 

  • WalkMe ‚Äì WalkMe can help you with the onboarding of new users (e.g., if you are bringing a new company code or new country rollout) as it helps drive user adoption using its capabilities to ease the use of the system by providing guided tours, samples, and even automations of tasks. At the moment, WalkMe provides out-of-the-box content for MyHome, Procurement Specialist, Sales Representative, and Financial Accountant, and more content will be added in the future. You can also use its current editor capabilities to create your own content and help drive user adoption and onboarding.

WalkMe & SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

  • SAP Signavio Process Intelligence is a good option to really understand how the system is being used and try to drive enhancements based on current system usage and KPIs. Currently, SAP Signavio Process Intelligence offers two out-of-the-box processes including Order to Cash and Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management (EPPM) that can be used to drive inferences on these end-to-end processes. More end-to-end processes will be added in the future. However, customers can use Process Mining to create their own content to analyze their specific usage and drive enhancements to the overall system productivity and usage based on very concrete production data to help drive transformation of processes.

SAP Signavio Process Intelligence & SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

If you want to know more about SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and SAP Signavio Process Intelligence, check this blog and example.

 

I hope this selective list of recommendations provides you some ideas for your new projects, new business rollouts, or new business requirements. Feel free to discuss these points with your SAP Customer Success Manager, SAP Account Executive, or SAP Partner.

Your insights and opinions are valuable, so please don't hesitate to contribute by commenting on this blog.

Follow us via @SAP and #S4HANA or follow @Marco_Valencia (SAP Business Suite Customer Success Management).

entry.title: Re: IAM Apps tab missing in Maintain Business Roles app after transport to QAS (S/4HANA Cloud Public
entry.content:
Hi @beampakorn and @Egbert_de_Jong ,

Sorry to hear this happens to both of you. I haven't experienced it.

In My blog, 

Using SAP CALM Features App to Track Transports in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, I created a user defined business role and transported to QAS and PRD in a 3 System Landscape environment. If you stop the video at 0'53" and 6'21", the IAM Apps tabs are there as shown below, G4Y: Dev-Customizing, G4Z: QAS, Q4X: PRD.

 

To help understand this problem, could you check if the IAM Apps tabs exist when you open a user role based on SAP template, i.e., not your creation, in your production system? Because if the IAM Apps tabs are there, you have all the authorizations.

 

To me this should not be your user role dependent. If you see it, you should see both in SAP delivered roles and your user defined roles as an administrator. The business catalogs you assigned into the user defined roles have nothing to do with yourself; it is for controlling access to those users using that role. You are not bound by that role.

 

Also, do you mind sharing your ticket number, so that I can take a look at your system directly?

 

Regards,

George

entry.title: Integra√ß√µes com APIs via SPROXY no Cen√°rio ABAP/PI: Um Guia Pr√°tico para Desenvolvedores SAP
entry.content:
Ol√°, galera da comunidade SAP da Bahia! Como curador dessa comunidade vibrante aqui no Nordeste, eu sempre fico animado em compartilhar conhecimentos que facilitam o dia a dia de voc√™s. Hoje, vou falar sobre um tema que √© p√£o com manteiga para quem trabalha com integra√ß√µes em ambientes SAP: as integra√ß√µes com APIs usando a transa√ß√£o SPROXY, especialmente no contexto ABAP/PI. J√° fiz algumas em projetos para conectar sistemas legados com servi√ßos externos, e acho que pode ajudar muita gente por a√≠.

Vou explicar passo a passo, de forma descomplicada, como se estiv√©ssemos batendo um papo no caf√© da firma (quem me conhece sabe que n√£o gosto de caf√©, mas serve o papo rsrs). No final, convido voc√™s a comentarem suas experi√™ncias ‚Äì quem sabe n√£o rola um meetup virtual sobre isso?

O que √© SPROXY e por que us√°-lo em ABAP/PI?

SPROXY √© uma transa√ß√£o SAP que permite gerar proxies ABAP a partir de defini√ß√µes de servi√ßos web, como WSDLs ou APIs RESTful. No cen√°rio de Process Integration (PI), que evoluiu para o SAP Process Orchestration (PO), ela √© essencial para criar interfaces que consumam ou exponham APIs de forma segura e eficiente.

Imagine que voc√™ precisa integrar o seu ERP SAP com uma API externa, tipo um servi√ßo de pagamento ou um CRM nuvem. Em vez de codar tudo do zero, o SPROXY gera classes ABAP prontas para uso, lidando com autentica√ß√µes, mapeamentos e erros. √â uma m√£o na roda para evitar bugs e acelerar o desenvolvimento.


Passo a Passo: Configurando uma Integra√ß√£o via SPROXY

Vamos ao que interessa ‚Äì o hands-on. Assumindo que voc√™ tem acesso a um ambiente ABAP/PI, siga esses passos. Eu testei isso em projetos reais, e sempre funciona bem com um pouco de paci√™ncia.

  1. Acessar a Transa√ß√£o SPROXY: Entre no SAP GUI e digite SPROXY na barra de comandos. Isso abre o Proxy Generation Tool. Selecione "Create Proxy" e informe a URL do WSDL da API que voc√™ quer integrar. (Dica: certifique-se de que o WSDL est√° acess√≠vel via HTTPS para evitar problemas de seguran√ßa.)

  2. Gerar o Proxy ABAP: O sistema analisa o WSDL e gera classes ABAP automaticamente. Voc√™ vai ver op√ß√µes para namespaces, pacotes de desenvolvimento e tipos de proxy (consumer ou provider). Escolha "Consumer Proxy" se for consumir a API. Aqui, o PI entra em jogo: configure o adapter no Integration Directory para mapear os campos.

  3. Implementar a L√≥gica no ABAP: Na SE38, SE80 ou Eclipse, acesse a classe gerada. Crie um m√©todo para chamar o proxy, passando par√¢metros como autentica√ß√£o (b√°sica ou OAuth).  Exemplo de c√≥digo simples:


Teste com o debugger para ver se os dados fluem corretamente.

  1. Configurar no PI/PO: No Integration Builder, crie um cen√°rio com o proxy como sender/receiver. Use adapters como SOAP ou HTTP para conectar √† API. Monitore via PIMON para logs e erros.

  2. Testes e Troubleshooting: Sempre teste com ferramentas como Postman antes de implementar. Problemas comuns? Certificados inv√°lidos ou timeouts ‚Äì verifique o SOAMANAGER para configura√ß√µes de endpoint.



Onde tem a Interface de Servi√ßo, vai aparecer duas Inboud e Outboud (clique com o bot√£o direito do mouse na qual deseja criar o proxy), ap√≥s isso, √© s√≥ ativar que o SAP vai gerar todos os objetos.

Vantagens e Desafios no Mundo Real

Nas implanta√ß√µes que fiz aqui na Bahia, com empresas locais de varejo e manufatura, o SPROXY salvou horas de desenvolvimento. Vantagens: integra√ß√£o nativa com ABAP, suporte a transa√ß√µes ass√≠ncronas e escalabilidade via PI. Mas desafios existem ‚Äì como lidar com APIs REST puras (o SPROXY √© mais SOAP-oriented, ent√£o use adapters para converter).

Se voc√™ est√° migrando para nuvem, fique de olho: isso √© base para entender evolu√ß√µes como o SAP BTP e Integration Suite, que modernizam tudo com low-code. (Falando nisso, em um pr√≥ximo post, vou correlacionar isso com as novas integra√ß√µes no BTP ‚Äì fiquem ligados!)

Conclus√£o e Chamada para A√ß√£o

Integra√ß√µes via SPROXY em ABAP/PI s√£o robustas e essenciais para quem ainda lida com on-premise, mas preparam o terreno para o futuro h√≠brido. O que voc√™s acham? J√° usaram SPROXY em projetos? Compartilhem nos coment√°rios, e vamos trocar figurinhas na comunidade SAP da Bahia. Se precisar de mais detalhes, me mandem DM!

Segue abaixo um passo a passo simples:

#SAP #ABAP #PI #Integra√ß√µes #APIs #SPROXY #ComunidadeSAPBahia

entry.title: Activate Joule Studio in 5 Simple Steps
entry.content:
Joule Studio is a capability in SAP Build that allows organizations to create and deploy custom Joule agents and skills that automate workflows and improve efficiency across SAP and non-SAP systems. Currently the Agent Builder offering is in Beta and the Skill Builder  offering is generally available. In this blog, we will focus on activation of the Skill Builder in Joule which is now Generally Available.

The key pre-requisites to activate Skill Builder with Joule Studio are as follows:-

  • Access to BTP Global Account with the following entitlements available via Subscription, BTPEA, CPEA or PAYG model:
    • SAP Build Process Automation, build-default (Application) plan
    • Joule, foundation (Application)/ standard (Application) plan
  • SAP Cloud Identity Services- Identity Authentication and Identity Provisioning instance is activated 

Read more about the service and pre-requisites in these following blogs from our product leaders and managers:

  • Joule Studio is generally available in SAP Build: Empower your business with intelligent automation
  • Build, Deploy, and Extend AI Agents with Joule Studio
  • How to Get Started with Joule Studio

Activating Joule Studio - Skill Builder in 5 Simple Steps

Here is a quick hit video capturing the steps documented below:

 

Step 1 - Create a BTP Subaccount and Assign the Entitlements:

Create a subaccount in your BTP Global Account and select region where both Joule, foundation/ standard and Build Process Automation, build-default plans are available. Find the list of regions supported for Joule service at this SAP Help Portal link and Build Process Automation Service at this SAP Help Portal link.

  • Click on Create button on BTP Global Account landing page and select Subaccount option

  • Enter the relevant details including selecting the suitable region and click on Create button

Enable Cloud Foundry Environment

  • Click on Enable Cloud Foundry button on the subaccount landing page

  • Update the details in the window and click on Create button

Create Space in the Cloud Foundry Environment

  • Select the Create Space button that appears after the Cloud Foundry Environment is created

  • Select the relevant roles and click on the Create button

Add Joule and  Build Process Automation entitlements

  • Navigate to Entitlements section from subaccount landing page
  • Click on Edit button

  • Select Add Service Plans button

 

  • Search for Joule in the search bar and select the foundation (Application) plan of the Joule service 

  • Next, search for build process in the search bar and select the build-default (Application) plan from SAP Build Process Automation service
  • Click on  Add 2 Service Plans button to add the entitlements to the relevant subaccount

  • Click on Save button on the Entitlements page

Step 2- Complete Trust Configuration and Activate Build Process Automation (Subaccount):

Create a Trust Configuration to add authentication for application users in the IAS tenant on BTP

  • Navigate to Security > Trust Configuration section under your BTP subaccount
  • Click on Establish Trust button

  • Select the suitable IAS tenant and click on Next button

  • Choose the domain consistent with your BTP account and non-BTP applications and click on the Next button

  • Review and update the relevant parameters in this screen and click on Next button

  • Review the details and click on Finish button

Enable the Build Process Automation Service, build-default plan

  • Navigate to Instances and Subscriptions section under your BTP subaccount and click on Create button

  • Select the SAP Build Process Automation service and build-default plan and click on Create button

  • The service will be created as seen under Subscriptions

Step 3 - Run Joule Booster to Activate Joule Studio Capability Package (Global Account):

Activate Joule Studio Capability Package on SAP Build Process Automation

  • Navigate to your BTP Global Account and select the Boosters section
    • Search for Joule in the search bar and select the Setting Up Joule booster tile

  • Click on Start button

  • After the prerequisites are checked and required entitlements are met, click on Next button 

  • Select the Joule (das-application) plan and the subaccount where Build Process Automation service is activated and click on Next button

  • After selecting the products to be integrated on the following screen and selecting relevant system type option click on Next button. Review Integrating Joule with SAP Solutions help document for more details on pre-requisites for integration with the relevant SAP systems in your organization

  • Select the SAP Build Process Automation option from the Capability Packages dropdown, click on Next button

  • Review the Formation Name and select the correct service instance number - URL from the SAP Build Process Automation System dropdown then click on the Next button

  • Review the details on the final page of the booster and click on Finish button

  • After processing, the Success window appears, click on the Close button after reviewing status

Step 4 - Create Role Collection and Assign Users (Subaccount):

Create Role Collection and assign the role collection the relevant users

  • Navigate to the Subaccount where the Build Process Automation service is installed and navigate to the Role Collections section and click on Create button; Enter the relevant details and click on Create button

  • Select the recently created role collection line item from the list and click on Edit button

  • Select search help option in first empty line item under Roles

  • Enter the search text "das" Application Identifier dropdown, select the right option from the list and select the end_user and extensibility_developer roles from the list below. Click on Add button after selecting the roles

  • Click the Save button for the role collection we created

  • Navigate to Users option under the Security section of the subaccount and click Create button

  • Select the Identity Provider for which the trust configuration was added, add the user details and click on Create button

  • Click on the new user created in the table, navigate to Role Collections section, click on the options(...) and select Assign Role Collections option

  • Select the role collection created in the previous step from the list along with any other relevant roles and click on the Assign Role Collection button

  • Navigate to Instances and Subscriptions and select the SAP Build Process Automation instance

  • Click on Create after the Build Lobby loads

  • The Joule Skill option should now be available for you to create custom Joule Skills

Step 5 - Build Your First Custom Joule Skill:

Follow the Build custom Joule skills for SAP and non-SAP systems using Joule Studio mission to get started with building your custom skills on Joule Studio.

Congratulations, you are all set to start building Custom Skills with the Skill Builder on Joule Studio!

Please do leave kudos and comments as feedback to help us keep improving the quality of our content.

Additional Resources 

Architecture Overview

Joule Skill Demo Video

Smart Advisory Companion ‚Äì Inspiration Video

üß≠ Product Tour

FAQ

entry.title: Re: ME22N screen line item 20 conditions cannot be seen s...
entry.content:
The error ‚ÄúNet price must be greater than 0‚Äù in ME22N usually occurs because the system is not picking up valid condition records (PB00, PBXX, etc.) or because pricing determination is incomplete. It is not caused by the screen alignment issue you mentioned

Below are some of the possible root causes

  • If PB00/PBXX or other pricing condition types are not maintained in the system, the PO line item cannot calculate a net price.
  • The pricing schema assigned to your vendor/purchase org may not be triggering the expected condition types.
  • In some cases, if account assignment or order unit is missing, the system resets the net price field, leading to the error

To fix this, perform the below steps

  • Go to transaction MEK3 or MEK2 and verify that PB00/PBXX records exist for the vendor, material, and purchasing org. If missing, maintain them in MEK1.
  • Verify Pricing Schema and ensure the schema assigned to your vendor/purchasing org includes PB00/PBXX.
  • In the PO line item, go to Conditions tab ‚Üí choose Update (Carry out new pricing). This forces the system to re-pull condition records.

entry.title: Re: Task List Operation linked with Functional location
entry.content:
Hi 

If the functional location (FL) is assigned to the task list operation and you expect this FL to flow into the operations of the maintenance order generated from the maintenance plan, here are the key steps and checks that will enable the behavior:

Ensure Task List Header vs. Operation Assignment

If you assigned the FL only to the task list header, the operations may not pick it up.

Better to assign the FL at the operation level of the task list (in IA05/IA06 or via the task list change transaction).

When you generate the order, the system will copy the operation-level object reference into the order operations.

Check the Maintenance Plan Scheduling Settings

In the maintenance plan (IP02/IP10), under ‚ÄúCall Object‚Äù, ensure that the task list is used and that the plan is defined so the header and operations will adopt the object reference (FL or equipment).

Important: In the maintenance plan header maintain the technical object field as well. If both FL and equipment are blank there, the order will not carry it.

Check the Order Type Settings for Object Reference Transfer

In SPRO ‚Üí Maintenance and Service Processing ‚Üí Maintenance and Service Orders ‚Üí Functions and Settings for Order Types ‚Üí ‚ÄúDefine Order Type‚Äù (OIS2)

Ensure the order type has the checkboxes ‚ÄúCopy object list‚Äù or ‚ÄúSupplied object reference‚Äù enabled. This allows object reference (FL/Equipment) to be copied from the plan to the order.

Task List Usage and Strategy

Make sure the task list version you used is active and your maintenance plan uses the correct version.

In case the object reference is dynamically supplied, check if Strategy allows ‚Äúdynamic object assignment‚Äù. For static FL reference, the FL must be entered in the task list.

Order Monitoring and Verification

After generating the order (via IP10 or automatic call), open the order (IW31/IW32) ‚Üí Go to ‚ÄúOperations‚Äù tab ‚Üí In each operation check the ‚ÄúTechnical Object‚Äù column where the FL should appear.

If still blank, test by manually creating an order using the same task list to check if the FL flows.

entry.title: Re: SAP PM. Issue in IW32 ‚Äì Adding Components via Structu...
entry.content:
Hi  charllotte ;

You can easily display and edit the Component Quantity field in your maintenance order.
Here‚Äôs how you can do it step-by-step in IW31 / IW32:

Go to 
Transaction IW31 or IW32 and open your order.

Navigate to the Components tab.

Make sure the equipment or functional location you‚Äôre using has a BOM (created in IB01 / IB02).
When you press the List button in the Components tab, the structure list from the BOM will appear.

Now, go to the top menu bar and choose:
Settings ‚Üí Field Selection ‚Üí Component.

In the pop-up window that appears, scroll on the right-hand side and look for the fields:

Comp. Qty (CUn)

Component Quantity

Move these fields to the upper section (Visible area) using the arrow buttons.
This will make the quantity column visible next to your material number in the component overview screen.

After saving this layout, you‚Äôll always see and can adjust the Component Quantity directly in the Components tab.

Hope this helps!
Best regards,
Ali Zamani
Senior SAP PM Consultant

entry.title: Re: Resource not available message in Work Order
entry.content:
Hi JAYA0511 ;

When you assign a personal number in the Person Responsible field in the header of a maintenance work order in SAP S/4HANA (PM module), and you get the message ‚ÄúResource is not available‚Äù, the root causes and configurations to check are:

Resource / Personnel Master Data Availability

The person you entered must exist as a resource or personnel record in SAP with correct availability. If the system treats the partner or resource as a ‚Äúpersonnel‚Äù but cannot find an active assignment or availability for that person, then ‚ÄúResource is not available‚Äù may appear.

Ensure the employee is represented in HR or as a Business Partner and linked to a work centre or scheduling node if you use scheduling.

For personnel resources, ensure the ‚ÄúWorkforce / Resource‚Äù setup is done and the resource is marked as available. See KBA 2979880 ‚Äì Search Help for ‚ÄòPerson Responsible‚Äô field.

Work Centre or Capacity/Resource Scheduling Check

If the work order uses capacity planning or resource scheduling (e.g., via SAP Multiresource Scheduling), the system checks if the assigned resource is free on the scheduled date/time. If the resource is already allocated, on leave, or not assigned to a valid work centre, the system may block with ‚ÄúResource is not available‚Äù.

SAP documentation states that during order release the system checks materials, production resources and tools.

Partner Function vs. Planning Function

The ‚ÄúPerson Responsible‚Äù in a work order header is a partner assignment, but not automatically treated as the operational resource unless you also assign the work centre or resource in the operations. If you only fill the partner field but operations belong to a work centre without linking the person, the system may interpret the resource as not available (because the scheduled operations still rely on the work centre resource).

Check if the partner function used (for example AUFTR) is intended for resource assignment or just for responsibility reporting.

Missing Configuration for Manual Assignment

In Customizing (SPRO) under Maintenance and Service Orders ‚Üí Functions and Settings for Order Types ‚Üí Scheduling / Capacity / Resource Planning, review whether the order type allows manual resource assignment or checks resource availability. If the setting ‚ÄúCheck capacities during release‚Äù is active, assignment of unavailable resource triggers the error.

entry.title: Re: Missing description in Key combination window in tran...
entry.content:
The missing descriptions in NACR when logged in with English are due to untranslated key combination texts (condition table descriptions). These are stored in customizing and can be translated using transaction SE63 (Translation Environment) or by maintaining the text entries in SPRO ‚Üí Output Control ‚Üí Condition Tables. In short: you need to translate the condition table descriptions (and possibly field catalog texts) into English.

In NACR, after selecting an application and output type, the system shows the key combinations (condition tables) available for maintaining condition records. Each key combination has a short description stored in the system. In your system, the German texts exist, but the English translations are missing, so when you log in with English, the nodes appear blank. This is not an ECC vs. S/4 issue‚Äîit‚Äôs simply a matter of missing translations in your customizing layer.

So with the above explanations, the fix is log in with English and open NACR. Note which nodes are blank. Identify the condition table numbers behind those nodes (you can see them in the technical view or via debugging). Go to SE63 and maintain the English translation for those tables. Save and transport the translations if needed.

entry.title: Re: Statistical Delivery Date Report in SAP S4 HANA
entry.content: There is no standard report in SAP ECC or S/4HANA, that directly compares Statistical Delivery Date vs. Delivery Date for all POs. However, you can get this information by using standard purchasing reports (ME2N/ME2M/ME2L/ME2K) with ALV layout changes, or by building a custom query (SQVI/SE16N) on tables like EKPO for PO items and EKET for schedule lines. To include the GR date, you need to join with MATDOC for material document or EKBE for PO history.

entry.title: Sydney Stammtisch Recap Oct '25
entry.content:
It couldn't rain for the 3rd ##SAPStammtischSYD in a row could it?  No, it couldn't!  We actually had a pretty nice day for it and the roof at The Paragon stayed wide open

As always, it was a real joy to see brand new faces joining us.  A joy too to see some unexpected reunions happen

As you can see from the photos we trialed a new system to make it easier for newcomers to get to know everyone: Stickers and a felt pen to write your name. Judging by the blank stickers left we had about 37 or 38 attendees. I think we should make this a regular thing

Thanks so much to everyone who came along to an event this year.  We are thrilled with the great attendance but would dearly love to improve the gender balance.  Please do let us know if you have any suggestions as to how we can assist with that

See you next year!  Get in touch (or leave a comment) if you have suggestions as to where we should be meeting and even whether we should try out a different night of the week

entry.title: Re: Balance Carryforward - S/4 Public Cloud
entry.content:
Good day @Yaya_AB 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Balance Carryforward, Extensibility, Field Extensibility in Revenue Accounting Posting,

Balance Carryforward, How to Run Balance Carryforward

Blog: S/4HANA Finance Balance Carryforward technical tip

That error occurs because when you create a custom field through the Custom Fields and Logic app, the system extends ACDOCA with the field, but it does not update the core balance carryforward program, which ensure aggregation of predefined dimensions (e.g., profit center) only. Hence, during carryforward, the system summarises balances per standard dimension and ignores custom field groupings as it did in your case.

To summarise, the issue you are facing is a standard behaviour in the public cloud edition. Considering the system Clean-Core approach, the balance carryforward process transfers only standard financial key figures that are part of the universal journal (table ACDOCA) and are recognised by the standard balance carryforward logic for example Company Code, G/L Account Ledger, etc.

Custom fields are not automatically carried forward, unless you have:

  • Extended them to the Universal Journal (ACDOCA), and
  • Marked them as ‚ÄúBalance Carryforward Relevant‚Äù in their field control settings (be aware that this is not available for all field types in public cloud).

 

SAP provides options on how you can handle such situations: Please note, the following screenshots are for reference purposes and might differ in your system.

Log onto the ‚ÄúCustom Fields and Logic‚Äù app -->

Locate your relevant custom field (Accounting Journal Entry Item) --> Click on arrow to the right.

Ensure business context is correct --> Confirm Field type, Length, UI texts are published.

Go back to home -->  search ‚ÄúBalance Carryforward‚Äù

Provide details e.g., fiscal year --> search your most recent --> display or create a new run test.

Back to home --> Open Display Line Items

in G/L √† Filter Ledger (same as carryforward), Fiscal year= new year, G/L Account = one from carryforward account √† click settings --> Manage Fields --> Add Fields and search for custom field and add it to the display columns.

If the opening balance entry appears but the custom field column is empty, that confirms it wasn‚Äôt carried forward and proves the standard balance carryforward logic mentioned earlier.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: RAP cross-BO - enrich root BO obj. page create w. cross-BO info (readonly)
entry.content:
Hi there,

is it possible to display some information of a cross-BO association as read only during the creation in the root BO using that association?

More specifically, the demo scenario I have has a simple Order + Item composition (Order = root BO) where the Order links to a Customer (Customer is another root BO) via a foreign key (Assoc. - Cross-BO). During the creation of the Order or by simple clicking on one, I'd like to display _some_ information of the "Customer" in there, without the displayed information being editable. Both the Order and the Customer are MANAGED implementations.

Example, creating an Order (App preview on Order BO, press Create, enter the Customer UUID):

Now we're on this page (see below). By using `with cross associations;` in the BDEF of the Order BO it correctly pulls the "FirstName" and "LastName" properties of the Customer.

These fields are not defined in the Order entity itself but are solely added by a corresponding facet. 

{ id: 'CUSTOMER', 
  position: 10, 
  label: 'Customer2', 
  type: #IDENTIFICATION_REFERENCE, 
  targetElement: '_Customer' }

Now the question is, can these fields be read only in this scenario? I have read the blog post from Cl√©ment about some cross-BO interactions but in there the fields (name, surname) are added to the entity directly and read from the "external BO" via a determination. So I thought, maybe it is possible without additionally adding these fields to the entity in this case?Is that a wrong mental model of mine, should I be ok with having these fields _again_? Is the scenario/use-case I think of a valid one? 

I also thought about setting readonly on the Customer BO for these fields but "readonly : update" would only allow for creation of a customer, never being able to update these fields (without add. actions ...) and the other way around (readonly : create, or only readonly) doesn't really make sense to me. And "readonly : instance" doesn't help either because I cannot determine from where or in which scenario I have been called (I think?) in order to make these fields readonly then.

The example is currently on the BTP Trial (us10) in the package `Z_MRB_RAP` but the code can also be checked in this github repo.

I don't think posting every CDS view piece by piece into this question helps, but if it is preferrable, please let me know!

Please note: The application consists mostly of only technical fields all over, nothing fancy (also no VH, only UUIDs ...), it is just for testing stuff out. Also, I don't know if this question is posted in the right ... board/forum ... feel free to point to the correct one. ^^

Any and all hints are appreciated. 

Regards, Marco

ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model

entry.title: Re: Customer Master Data - Updation in SAP S/4 Hana Publi...
entry.content:
Good day @Tehreem_Fatima1 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Manage Business Partner Master Data

SAP Business Accelerator Hub (information about APIs)

Overview | Business Partner (A2X) | SAP Business Accelerator Hub

Business Partner Integration (with a link to the documentation in SAP Help portal)

To summarise, yes, the ‚ÄúStart Mass Maintenance- Business Partner‚Äù app has been deprecated in the latest public cloud releases. It was done to align with the clean-core and controlled data governance principles that is the foundation of all business-partner maintenance in the cloud.

However, you can achieve the same results with supported, clean-core alternative.

For you to see the new Business Partner, you will require the following role assigned to your system:

  • Business Catalog: SAP_CA_BC_BP_MANAGE_PC (Business Partner-Master Data Management) &
  • Business Role Template: SAP_BR_BUSINESS _PARTNER_SPECIALIST

An option would be to make use of the ‚ÄúData Migration Cockpit‚Äù that handles Mass Updates. Open the app

Create a project with the migration object Business Partners. Export your current data -->  Update the field offline, and re-upload records.

You can also consider using the SAP Master Data Integration or API approach through SAP BTP Integration Suite (CPI) or external tools.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Adding F4 value help to Custom Business object
entry.content:
Hello @Kathiravan_S1 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Custom Business Objects, Adding a Value Help with the Custom CDS Views App

Blog: Custom field type ‚ÄúCode list based on CDS view‚Äù: Finding/defining the right value help view and the right Semantic Object and Semantic Object Parameter for Intent-Based Navigation

This is a common issue when creating F4 associations between Custom Business Objects and Custom CDS Views in public cloud. Even if the CDS view returns data in preview, the value help can display that error if some criterias are not met.

To summarise, the error ‚ÄúNo Data Found‚Äù message occurs because the CDS view was not exposed as a proper Value Help scenario or it has a data type/Join mismatch. Once you republish the CDS view with the Usage Type= Value Help and reassign it to the CBO field, the F4 help will correctly display all values.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to Configure Barcodes in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public...
entry.content:
Good day @MohamedKharbouch 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud ‚Äì Output Management - Barcodes and QR Codes on forms

Output Management, Output Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Highlights of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition 2308 Release

Below you will find a summary of your questions:

To answer your first question, on the configuration steps that you require in enabling barcode scanning in public cloud. Barcode scanning does not require a dedicated activation in public cloud. It works automatically in compatible Fiori apps when the users‚Äô device supports a scanner. In your Central Business Configuration ensure you check that:

  • In the Define Movement Types (SSCUI 102012), standard movements (e.g., 101, 311, 261) are active.
  • In the Maintain Form Templates, is active as they are required to print barcodes or QR codes on output documents.
  • Align your Material Number Display Format with GTIN or external numbering if barcodes are printed.

On your question about maintaining Barcode or GTIN, the answer is, you store barcode values as GTIN in the product master.

Open Manage Product Maser data --> select a product

--> navigate to Basic Data --> Identification numbers --> enter your EAN/UPC (GTIN) value.

This GTIN can later be printed on label or forms and is automatically recognised during scanning in logistics transactions.

The answer to question 3: Goods receipt (Purchasing), Goods Receipt (Production), Inventory Transfers, Physical Inventory, Outbound Delivery and Goods Issue for Order are examples of standard Fiori apps already containing a scanner icon beside key input field. If you use handheld devices, SAP Warehouse Operator App and SAP Mobile Start supports barcode/camera scanning.

 

Answer to question 4: Output Management and Adobe Forms handle form printing.

Open Maintain Form Templates App.

Copy the standard form MM-PUR-PURCHASE-ORDER-FORM or SD_DELIVERY_NOTE. (screenshot uses a pseudo form)

  • Then download and open in Adobe LiveCycle Designer.
  • Thereafter insert a Barcode Field or QR Code Field and bind it to a data element.
  • Choose the desired symbology (Code128, EAN13, or QR Code).
  • Upload √†Publish the update form.

This allows the warehouse and production teams to scan printed documents directly in subsequent transactions.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Drive more business outcomes out of your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ‚Äì A Recommendation Gui
entry.content:
Hi Egbert,

The Parallel Line is included in the subscription for customers in a 3 System Landscape. There is a setup that can be triggered via SAP for Me, which requires some prerequisites but is managed entirely by SAP. The blog I included provides steps to start with the setup, which we call "Branching." Signavio offers a 30-day trial that includes Process Intelligence. You can refer to this link for the trial: https://editor.signavio.com/p/register?pgid=0&sgnv_campaign=Free%20trial&sgnv_content=global&sgnv_medium=button&sgnv_source=website. Alternatively, you can also request a demo here: https://www.signavio.com/request-a-demo/. In reference to the naming, I also included the SAP Business Suite Blog - https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/unpacking-the-new-sap-business-suite/ba-p/14191891. We now refer to everything relevant to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and its extended capabilities offered in the SAP Business Suite Packages as "SAP Cloud ERP." I hope this helps.
